name: Michoacan Guanajuato volcanic ﬁeld
author: Maciel Peña et al. (2009)
age constraints: Ar-Ar ages of 82 to 612 ka (from another study)

name: Tequila volcanic ﬁelds
author: Ceja et al. (2006)
age constraints: Ar/Ar ages of 0.115 to 1.13 Ma (from another study)

name: Trans-Mexican Volcanic Belt
author: Mejia et al. (2005)
age constraints: 7 Ar/Ar ages from 1.28±0.54 to 4.14±0.37 Ma; we take the age as 1-5 Ma

name: Trans Mexican Volcanic Belt
author: Ruiz-Martínez et al. (2010)
age constraints: all Pliocene age rocks (some K-Ar dated)

name: Eastern Alkaline Province
author: Goguitchaichvili et al. (2007)
age constraints: magnetostratigraphy and K-Ar ages of 1.5 to 7.5 Ma

name: Trans Mexican Volcanic Belt
author: Ruiz-Martínez et al. (2010)
age constraints: all Miocene age rocks (some K-Ar dated)

name: USGS SW North America composite
author: Mankinen (2008)
age constraints: Late Miocene pole (~10 to 5 Ma), ages of 5.16 to 9.9 Ma

name: Hepburn's Mesa Formation
author: Burbank and Barnosky (1990)
age constraints: 16.8 Ma to 14.3 (or 13.8) Ma, constrained by magnetostratigraphy and fossils

name: Younger plutons
author: Hagstrum and Johnson (1986)
age constraints: 22 to 23 Ma K-Ar and fission-track ages

name: Conejos and Hinsdale Formation
author: Brown and Golombek (1997)
reliability: deemed unreliable by Besse and Courtillot due to possible rotation
age constraints: one K-Ar age of 26 Ma (uncertainty from GPDB and BC02)

name: East Fork Washakia Basin
author: Flynn (1986)
reliability: deemed unreliable by Besse and Courtillot due to possible rotation

name: Absaroka ﬂows
author: Shive and Pruss (1977)
reliability: age changed slightly to follow GPDB and KI10, plat and plon changed to follow paper (and GPDB, VDV90 and KI10)

name: Rattlesnake Hills volcanics
author: Sheriff and Shive (1980)
reliability: deemed unreliable by Besse and Courtillot due to possible rotation
age constraints: estimated volcanic activity from 50 to 42 (8 Myr time period), based on radiomatric ages (also age range in VDV90)

name: Monterey intrusives
author: Ressetar and Martin (1980)
age constraints: K-Ar ages from paper give 42-47 Ma

name: Absorako volcanics
author: Harlan and Morgan (2010)
reliability: deemed unreliable by Besse and Courtillot due to possible rotation

name: Wasatch and Green River Formation
author: Clyde et al. (1997)
reliability: deemed unreliable by Besse and Courtillot due to possible rotation

name: Adel Mountain volcanics
author: Gunderson and Sheriff (1991)
age constraints: K-Ar ages of 71.2±2.7 Ma to 81.1±3.5 Ma (this paper)

name: Doherty Mountain sills
author: Harlan et al. (2008)
age constraints: Two Ar/Ar biotite ages of 77 Ma (77.18±0.31 Ma and 77±0.31 Ma)

name: Niobrara Formation
author: Shive and Frerichs (1974)
age constraints: Late Coniacian to early Maastrichtian (consistent with VdV90); also taken as 85-89 Ma (Gunderson and Sheriff, 1991; Besse and Courtillot, 1991)

name: Maudlow Formation welded tuffs
author: Swenson and McWilliams (1989)
age constraints: Latest Santonian to latest Campanian; 74.9±1.0 and 83±2 Ma K-Ar ages

name: Elkhorn Mountains
author: Diehl (1991)
age constraints: early Campanian age from stratigraphic/paleontologic data; K-Ar ages of lower member of 80.8±2.4 and 79.6±2.4 Ma

name: Magnet Cove and other intrusions
author: Globerman and Irving (1988)
age constraints: Magnet Cove: 97 and 99 Ma K-Ar, 101 Rb-Sr and 97 and 102 Ma fission track ages. Potash Sulfur Springs: 100 ± 2 Ma Pb/Pb age and 99.8 and 102.4 fission track ages.

name: Alfred Complex
author: McEnroe (1996b)
reliability: high-T CHRM, exsolution lamellae and fine reaction rims, vector plots, no structural correction, rock mag
age constraints: K-Ar of biotite in gabbro 120.0±2 Ma, readings on gabbro and monzodiorite

name: Cape Neddick
author: McEnroe (1996b)
reliability: high-T CHRM, exsolution lamellae and fine reaction rims, vector plots, no structural correction, rock mag
age constraints: 120.6±0.4 Ma Ar-Ar on biotite in gabbro

name: Tatnic Complex
author: McEnroe (1996b)
reliability: high-T CHRM, exsolution lamellae and fine reaction rims, vector plots, no structural correction, rock mag
age constraints: 122±2; K-Ar on biotite in gabbro, Ar-Ar on biotite from Qtz-diorite

name: Lebanon diorite
author: McEnroe (1996b)
reliability: high-T CHRM, exsolution lamellae and fine reaction rims, vector plots, no structural correction, rock mag
age constraints: 125±3 Ma K-Ar on biotite. They discarded discordant Ar-Ar ages, should be revised.
